planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun and is known for its extreme temperatures, ranging from scorching hot to freezing cold.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is often referred to as Earth's 'sister planet' due to its similar size but has a thick, toxic atmosphere and a surface hot enough to melt lead.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: The third planet from the Sun and the only known celestial body to support life. Earth is a diverse and beautiful planet with a wide range of ecosystems.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: The fourth planet from the Sun, often called the 'Red Planet' due to its reddish appearance. Mars has been a target for human exploration and potential colonization.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: The largest planet in our solar system, Jupiter is a gas giant with a strong magnetic field and a turbulent atmosphere. It has a ring system and numerous moons.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Saturn is famous for its stunning ring system, which consists of icy particles and debris. It is another gas giant in our solar system.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is a unique ice giant planet that rotates on its side, giving it a distinct appearance in our solar system.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the eighth and farthest known planet from the Sun. It is an ice giant with a deep blue color and a dynamic atmosphere.
